message.content:
<<<api>>>: ImageIO.write
<<<code>>>: 
public class Image {
    private static final String path = "C:/Users.../src/7horses.jpg";
    private static final File file = new File(path);

    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
        BufferedImage img = ImageIO.read(file);
        File outputfile = new File("C:/Users.../src/copy.jpg");
        ImageIO.write(img, "jpg", outputfile);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The ImageIO.write method is used to write an image to an output stream. In this case, the output stream is a file. The method takes three parameters: the image to be written, the format of the image (in this case, "jpg"), and the output stream. This will create an exact copy of the image without reducing the quality.
